title: Patriots get positive injury updates on Christian Gonzalez, Khyiris Tonga
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Both Gonzalez and Tonga were full participants at practice on Thursday.

Khyiris Tonga Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe The Patriots received some welcome news on Thursday, with cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive tackle Khyiris Tonga able to fully participate at practice.
Gonzalez, who left last Sunday’s wild-card win against the Chargers early because of a head injury, has been going through the NFL’s concussion protocol this week.

title: Readers judge Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, and Jimmy Fallon’s Mass. town pronunciations
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Readers Say A majority of respondents said their hometown passed the test — but Quincy (and a few other classics) sparked loud debate.
“Yeah, they kind of did Quincy dirty," one reader said.

title: Meet the Newton couple who visited every town in Massachusetts
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News Jenny McBride and Jo Gray visited all 351 towns and cities in Massachusetts.
Here’s what they learned along the way.

title: Mass. police officer placed on leave following high-speed, head-on collision, chief says
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Local News The off-duty officer could face charges including reckless operation of a motor vehicle, a marked lanes violation (two counts), and speeding.
A Massachusetts police officer was placed on administrative leave pending an investigation into a multi-vehicle crash this weekend in which speed was allegedly a factor.
The off-duty Marshfield officer, who authorities have not publicly identified, was the driver of a Jeep involved in the serious crash on Plain Street shortly after 9 p.

author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Making up a very New England food hall, Kowloon, Ernie Boch Jr.
